title: Effect of chemical on a protein

content.question: A chemical binds to a protein composed of a single polypeptide chain and prevents the formation of an alpha helix that is typically formed in the absence of the chemical. Which of the following best describes the effect the chemical has on the structure of the protein?

choices.label: The primary structure held together by covalent bonds is affected.
The secondary structure held together by hydrogen bonds is affected.
The secondary, tertiary, and quaternary structures are affected.
All levels of protein structure are affected.

content.answer: The secondary structure held together by hydrogen bonds is affected.
